content: return to the forest by celtic handknits cernunnos - typically depicted as a human figure with stag antlers is the celtic god of the forest and wild animals the shedding and regrowth of the stag s antlers symbolise new beginnings this set in forest green is a reminder of ancient simpler and more natural times a return to nature wild animals and the forest cowl instructions using 4mm us 6 needles co 43 sts measurements beginning rib 12cm 4 7in wide 72cm 28 4in long row 1 rs s1 k1 p1 20 times k1 s1 materials row 2 p2 k1 p1 20 times p1 these 2 row form rib work in rib for a further 4 ❖ 4 0mm us 6 and 5 0mm us 8 needles row ❖ appx 220m 240yds stylecraft special aran row 7 rib 10 sts bobble 3 sts rib 6 sts bobble 3 sts with wool shade 2424 ocean twice rib 9 sts ❖ cable needle row 8 rib 10 sts co 3 sts rib 7 sts co 3 sts twice rib 10 sts gauge work in rib for 7 more row 24 row and 18 sts over 10cm/4in in stocking st next row p2 k1 p1 9 times k1 p2tog p1 k1 9 times p2 42 sts abbreviations cn cable needle cable pattern k knit change to 5mm us 8 needles p purl row 1 rs k6 p2 c4b c4f p2 twice k6 co cast on row 2 p6 k2 p8 k2 twice p6 bobble bind off row 3 k6 p2 k8 p2 twice k6 st stitch row 4 as row 2 sts stitches row 5 c6b p2 c4b c4f p2 twice c6b round round row 6 as row 2 decrease decrease row 7 k6 p2 k8 p2 twice k6 s1 slip one st knitwise row 8 as row 2 m1 pick up the loop between last and next stitch these 8 row set the patt continue in patt until and work into the back of this loop work measures 62cm/24 4in from co edge ending rs right side on a rs row ws wrong side next row p6 k2 p8 k2 p3 m1 p3 k2 p8 k2 p6 patt pattern 43 sts k2tog knit 2 together p2tog purl 2 together finishing rib ssk slip next 2 sts knitwise separately slip both back to left needle k2tog through back loop change to 4mm us 6 needles c6b slip next 3 stitches onto cn and hold at back beginning with row 1 of rib work 24 row of rib of work k3 then k3 from cn ending with a ws row c4b slip next 2 stitches onto cn and hold at back of work k2 then k2 from cn to complete c4f slip next 2 stitches onto cn and hold at front cast off in patt and weave in ends of work k2 then k2 from cn place beginning rib on top of finishing rib with left m marker hand side of beginning rib lined
